intro: Stichorkis scleriifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and deep green, with flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Stichorkis scleriifolia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
